definition: Good Friday
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month

sentences.english: Their birthday is on the mother's suffering.
sentences.chinese: 自己的生日就是母親的受難日。

sentences.english: Many retailers offer online deals for Black Friday.
sentences.chinese: 很多零售商人會在耶穌受難日提供網上交易。

sentences.english: The crude oil market remained closed Friday in observance of the Good Friday holiday.
sentences.chinese: 週五因慶祝耶穌受難日，原油市場休市。

sentences.english: One theory is that Friday is the crucifixion of Jesus, Zhuxiong.
sentences.chinese: 一種說法是，星期五是耶酥受難日，所以主兇。

sentences.english: In Christianity, the rooster is a symbol of Jesus Christ's final days.
sentences.chinese: 基督教中，公雞讓人想到耶穌臨終受難日的那幾天。

definition: to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
to pray on behalf of sb
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
to celebrate a birthday (of an elderly person)
to stay young forever
as to/considering/for
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another

to pay one's last respects
Thank heavens!/Thank goodness that's worked out so well!
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
to plan a military mission on a sand table (idiom)/to rehearse a planned action or activity/to conduct a dry run
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
